website_summaries.verdict: This guide's pictorial table of contents helps you identify species before the specimen flutters away.
pros: More than 2,300 pictures of butterflies in natural poses
Also features color plates of rare butterflies seen along the Mexican border
cons: A bit too technical for some
Markings can be too small for some to see in pictures

customer_reviews.title: Printed in China Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: I will not purchase any additional books in this series. The cover is paper and is not durable. After 5 minutes of use it is cracking and looks worse than my Peterson handbook that is 40 yearsold. I will return
customer_reviews.author: mechE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this book,it's easy to find butterfly name,map and habits and plants!
customer_reviews.author: JoyC

customer_reviews.title: Time To Go Butterfly Hunting!
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully illustrated and detailed guide to butterflies of North America. The guide breaks down how to identify butterflies correctly by telling you what to look for; size, shape, posture, flight style, and fine details. As a beginner this is very helpful because some look very similar, such as the California Sister or the Lorquin's Admiral. There is so much information but the guide makes it easy by providing clear info on ranges, habitat and seasons, plus how to accurately use the guide itself. As with the "Field Guide to Birds of North America," Kaufman Guides do not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Matthews

customer_reviews.title: What a great field guide
customer_reviews.text: What a great field guide. The maps are so helpful, since many butterflies look alike. Behavior descriptions and great pictures make this very easy & useful. Makes me, a novice, feel a little better when they say things like, "difficult to distinguish or positively I.D." some types.
customer_reviews.author: jlil

customer_reviews.title: A small price for all the work that went into this excellent compendium
customer_reviews.text: As a field guide it is a bit heavy, but the durable cover, binding and paper quality add to the book's endurance so it's a worthwhile tradeoff. The book is well-designed with color-coded pages and range maps that make this book easy to use. I like that it lists the larval food plants in an index. Now and then there's a photo of a butterfly species' larva; had they all been included this would be the consummate book, but also twice the size.
customer_reviews.author: Shuttered

customer_reviews.title: Great guide with pictures and regions ideal for any who ...
customer_reviews.text: Great guide with pictures and regions ideal for any who want to know how to identify and where to find butterflies. For those who want comprehensive knowledge about butterflies and their life cycles and habits: get a different book. This is a field guide and describes each species quickly
customer_reviews.author: Kenzi Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Ol' Kaufman does it again!
customer_reviews.text: I am a avid birder and have been for many years. I am very familiar with Kenn Kaufman's guides and find them useful. I am currently getting into the butterflies of my area and needed a guide to help me with the species I find. The information is very current and explains the specie very well. The illustrations are excellent with great detail and the size shadow on each illustration page is such a great reference tool. I love this book and it has helped me ID over 50 species. Especially the skippers. I highly recommend this field guide to anyone interested. It's vivid illustrations and small, but durable size, make it a great companion.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Detailed
customer_reviews.text: This is a detailed field guide that includes many more species than another guide I already had. There are many color plates. I would recommend this to anyone who is interested in identifying butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Russell

customer_reviews.title: This is beautiful and comprehensive
customer_reviews.text: This is beautiful and comprehensive, but a little overwhelming. It would be a good companion to Butterflies and Moths - A Golden Guide. I like that there are US maps for location and a few comparative photos (Monarch vs Admiral).
customer_reviews.author: oceanlover

customer_reviews.title: great book very descriptive
customer_reviews.text: this book is better than the ad says, everything ready at your fingertips. the wife really enjoys this. now she can identify more butterfly's than I thought we had. the color pictures are the best and the book describes everything even for a seasoned lepidopterist. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Country boy

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Very informative!
customer_reviews.text: Great book! very informative. I love photographing butterflies and wanted a book to help me identify all the different butterflies I find. So glad I got this book!
customer_reviews.author: A. Moss

customer_reviews.title: A great resource, this is my primary field guide for butterflies
customer_reviews.text: This is my second butterfly field guide, and I find this one much easier to use. On each species, it has a watermark showing the expected size, and includes range maps on the same page as well, which helps to easily eliminate the unlikely candidates. It also shows male and female images when these differ, and also highlights the field marks to make identification easier.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Best allround butterfly guide
customer_reviews.text: I have several butterfly books, and I always come back to this one. I have maybe an old edition, the names aren't always up to date, but what's new about that? Then I go to Opler's for more info if I need it. My only complaint: that to be sure of the family/subfamily of the butterfly you have to go back to introductory material before each section.
customer_reviews.author: PatN

customer_reviews.title: Handy Butterfly Field Book
customer_reviews.text: I go to the Zoo & walk in the Park every day. I love Butterflies and needed a book to look up what I've seen. This book is a Field guide, but a little too heavy for my to carry around. So I take a point n shoot digital camera and take hundreds of pictures. Then I get home and spend hours documenting them. The pictures on most are life size and all phases of their life. Great color pictures of all with information about them all including where they can be found. I love this book. Well worth the price to butterfly lovers in the United States.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Klipp

customer_reviews.title: Great ID booo
customer_reviews.text: Use this book at work almost weekly during spring and summer. Once you understand d how it’s organized it’s easy to use and has great pictures to help ID.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hoping it had pics of the catapillars to butterflies it not.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Best butterfly guide for 'newbies'
customer_reviews.text: A long-time birder, I've begun exploring butterflies and found many of the guides for them to be incomplete or unhelpful. This one by Kenn Kaufman is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: AAS

customer_reviews.title: Comprehinsive, nice pictures and logically designed
customer_reviews.text: In my humble opinion, most field guides are not logically designed. If you have a bird or butterfly in front of you, you may not have half an hour to thumb through the book looking for a likely suspect. This book has a few little aids that make searching faster and easier. The pictures are pretty good and show the tops and bottoms of the wings which is very important. Also important, it is complete. Most field guides leave a lot of butterflies out. I have four other field guides that are pretty much worthless. This is the best I've found so far.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: It will teach you to ID butterflies
customer_reviews.text: Best book for identifying butterflies that I’ve found. Easy to understand, with range maps next to the pictures and descriptions. Keys to identification provided both in text and indicators on the drawings. This book taught me how to identify butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Miller

customer_reviews.title: For both novice and experienced
customer_reviews.text: I already had a copy, which is my favorite for butterfly identification. This was a gift. I highly recommend for both novice and experienced. Good illustrations and range maps.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia McAlister

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures for identification. I love the front section that breaks down the type of butterflies to send you in the right direction. I also love the habitat and habits part of the book.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pictures but I found it difficult to use. But, then, what is easy about classifying butterflies?
customer_reviews.author: Gaynl B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that the book does not include ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the book does not include enough moth species to identify everyone in my butterfly garden.
customer_reviews.author: dogatty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for adults & kids!
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous, informative book. Bought it bc my 6 year old wanted a butterfly book "like our bird book." Our 10 year old daughter likes to look up butterflies we see outside in it & she is able to find them and read about them.
customer_reviews.author: vegansince1997

customer_reviews.title: Well Organized
customer_reviews.text: This is a very clearly written, well organized book. It compares to Butterflies Through Binoculars. But I found this one very easy to use for our annual butterfly count when "catchers" are bringing in all the butterflies they catch and I have to identify them rather rapidly!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: If you like learning about butterflys purchase this guide!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful guide to learn and grow in knowledge of these beauties!
customer_reviews.author: Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book
customer_reviews.text: I raise butterflies and I love this book. It's a great tool to see what butterflies and skippers are in my area and what I can plant to attract them to my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It was divided into easy to find color sections and was very complete. If you enjoy butterflies good to have handy.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Louis

customer_reviews.title: A great and very useful field guide
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying looking at this book even though it's now too cold here for hunting butterflies. The illustrations are very clear, the range maps are *extremely* helpful, and the important field markings are well pointed out. It looks like a book that will be going with my camera and I a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Booklogged

customer_reviews.title: Love Butterflies
customer_reviews.text: Building up our yard for butterflies and other lovely nature and pollinators. Nice book to add to our collection
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Love this guidebook!
customer_reviews.text: I have thoroughly enjoyed using this guide. It has clear, detailed illustrations, including regional/seasonal differences in color/markings, and lots of great information (such as habitat, larvae food, range, migration, and behavior). An excellent reference.
customer_reviews.author: J. DoyleTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Book
customer_reviews.text: My first butterfly book was Peterson's First Guides Butterflies and Moths. I found it hard to use. So I bought this book. It is very easy to use. The organization is terrific with a pictorial index that makes looking for the different species very easy. It is small and compact with beautiful pictures that have arrows to the important markings, photos of the different life stages, pictures of both tops and bottoms and a shadow of the actual size. I really like the way it classifies the the species which makes it easy to learn and remember.
customer_reviews.author: JAKindle

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies of North America
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent field guide. Well illustrated with detailed information on species, variations, habitat and food plants.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Clayden

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who enjoys watching butterflies in my flower garden, I felt it was time to learn to identify them. This book is so clear, the photos so brilliant. All of those varieties now have a name and a lot of interesting attributes worthy of notice.
customer_reviews.author: Chickadee

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Illustrations are beautifully done and the text helps to identify the different species of butterflies I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: lovestoread

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies of North America Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this book as a gift for my mother. This is a great field guide showing detailed pictures and geographic locations for North American Butterflies. If you love identifying Butterflies this is a must have field guide. My purchase arrived sooner than expected in adequate packaging to prevent damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Duce

customer_reviews.title: Good pictures and summaries
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures and info. Wish they had regional guides, almost too much info because the whole world is documented. Would love to have one just for the Midwest area.
customer_reviews.author: Jozie

customer_reviews.title: A perfect guide to butterflies
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected and described. It's everything you need to identify butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Kabbie

customer_reviews.title: She absolutely loved it! Super easy to read and understand with ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my Mom, who loves butterflies. She absolutely loved it! Super easy to read and understand with beautiful images. The book is perfect pocket size for travel or out in the field and is very well made with glossy pages.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Good Reference -- Sturdy Book Construction
customer_reviews.text: Solidly made reference book with good images. Especially like the color coded tab markers and the "Pictorial Table of Contents." This makes identifying unfamiliar butterflies easier to find in the book. The firm, reinforced cover will help this book survive the out of doors and the many years of use I plan to give it.
customer_reviews.author: j m

customer_reviews.title: Good book.
customer_reviews.text: Well laid out, with nicely drawn illustrations. We found it very helpful in identifying the butterflies in our back yard.
customer_reviews.author: awl588

customer_reviews.title: We like this book.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy to use book. The pictures make identifying the butterflies in our yard easy. We use this book quite often as the butterflies are migrating at this time of year.
customer_reviews.author: gail

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guide for Butterfly ID
customer_reviews.text: Excellent illustrations, easy to carry in vest pocket and useful in identification.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman's Guides are my Favorites
customer_reviews.text: I own several of Kaufman's bird guides too and have always considered them my first choice for my backpack. This butterfly guide is also well thought out and I've used it a lot. I have several smart phone apps for butterflies as well, but I still prefer the book. The pictures are bigger with more detail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: All four field guides were Christmas gifts to 5 year old granddaughters. They enjoy going on nature hikes and identifying what they observe.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra2002

customer_reviews.title: This is THE butterfly book.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this book as a wildlife professional and it seems to be the best one for experienced and for beginners of butterfly identification. Great pictures and the shadows on the page that show actual size are a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rutter

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: A few years ago I started getting interested in butterflies and went to the library for an identification book, and ended up with Kaufman's. I was instantly hooked on a hobby that makes bird watching seem kind of boring, and decided to order a book of my own. But in order to save a few bucks I decided on another guide, and when It arrived realized I'd made a mistake. So I ordered this book and know I have the best. I'll be checking into other Kaufman guides.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hibdon

customer_reviews.title: Making Sense
customer_reviews.text: Organization is the key to this excellent field guide. Butterflies are difficult to see clearly. This guide allows the observer to quickly get into the proper grouping or order, which is necessary before individual markings or behaviors can be noted. Good for anyone, I think this guide will be especially helpful for beginning butterfly watchers.
customer_reviews.author: Henthabox

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman's Butterfly book
customer_reviews.text: I'm working on the State of Maine's Butterfly survey, and have found the Kaufman book to be a valuable reference guide. Pictures and descriptions are very clear. I like the arrows that point to distinguishing field marks, to help in narrowing down the identification of species. Having all the info on the page you are opened to is also helpful when you are busy in the field. Being a visual person I appreciate ALL the butterfly plates are in color. My only one thought is I would like to see more of the caterpillars included. There are some included but not all. All in all a very good field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Leapntrout

customer_reviews.title: Just got this book and it looks very nice! Good pictures and descriptions
customer_reviews.text: Just got this book and it looks very nice! Good pictures and descriptions. I do wish some book would describe the all subspecies in full. Great Book!
customer_reviews.author: Coleen A. Loeffler

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman's Guide Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Kaufman's field guides (butterflies, insects, birds, etc.) are perfect, or nearly perfect, due in large part to the unique digitally enhanced photographs used. The range maps are also first class. I use other butterfly and insect guides to supplement information provided by the Kaufman guides.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fred Zeillemaker

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman Butterflies of North America
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST HAVE for any butterfly enthuiast, or merely one who enjoys butterflies and would like to know their name. With the "Butterflies of Houston...." it is all that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Larry A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Identification Book!
customer_reviews.text: This is intuitively laid out, I have an easier time finding what I am looking for with this than I do with most internet resources and certainly easier than any other book I have tried. This has plenty of good pictures and info as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Great handbook! I have had no problems using it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great handbook! I have had no problems using it for IDing, and I am a novice. I like the way they have set up the book to easily guide you to the right type of butterfly.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Glass

customer_reviews.title: If you need a book on Lep's
customer_reviews.text: I've found the style of this book to be very helpful. The illustrations are clear, and the species' habits are concise and interesting. I've used this book a few times in the short period of owning it, and I highly recommend this to anyone who walks the woodlands looking for Lep's.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Michels

customer_reviews.title: Excellent field guide
customer_reviews.text: Excellent field guide: complete, accessible, reliable and cheap. Only the illustrations could be much better in terms of sharpness and color rendering (but websearches easily compensate this).
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies are free
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 of these as awards for first prize for a student butterfly art competition. I was previously familiar with this guide, and decided that it was perfect for beginners wishing to learn about and identify the butterflies of North America. It is easy to use and well - organized, and they arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: JL of Suffern,NY

customer_reviews.title: NICE COMPACT
customer_reviews.text: This is compact and informational... similar to my favourite 1966 "Birds of North America field guide -- Just what I was hoping for... a great gift from a butterfly fan to a butterfly fan... thanks , bill
customer_reviews.author: PIA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves having this book for referencing her butterfly collection. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: janet swenerton

customer_reviews.title: Great book for anyone wanting to improve butterfly ID skills
customer_reviews.text: Great field guide for those that are less experienced and even some that are well-versed in Butterfly ID. I've found that the pictures and descriptions are excellent and it has improved my ability to determine which species are which.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: Get this book
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone getting into butterflies. My favorite in my collection and the first I go to when trying to identify a butterfly.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Best guide ever
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures. I have another butterfly guide but this beats it. Information given is clear and easy to understand .
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Hook

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Book
customer_reviews.text: This covers many butterflies with descriptions and beautiful pictures. I appreciated having information as to usual possible locations for their living and migratory places,
customer_reviews.author: B. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for Id'ing butterflies in the backyard. it requires some expertise to know what kind you are looking for, but if you have time, it's a great resourse. Beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.author: jofjones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reference book with beautiful photos and clear descriptions. Wonderful for hiking and travel.
customer_reviews.author: Godog

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Being a novice, this book has enough knowledge for me. Of particular importance are pictures of the butterflies with their wings OPEN & CLOSED, plus the shadow image at the top of the page showing the actual size of the pictured butterfly.
customer_reviews.author: Billie M

customer_reviews.title: Very comprehensive book
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for butterfly photographers. I not only like to photograph butterflies and moths, I want to know the name of what I've imaged. This book is a great help for me.
customer_reviews.author: Roger F. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: For great field use-This is the book on Butterflies!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly our needs-daily inventory of butterflies in our 40 acre natural prairie. Book jacket is weather-worthy, too! Suggest that users learn how the book is organized before going into the field.
customer_reviews.author: Richard James Van Iten

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly field guide.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my two favorite butterfly field guides and the one that covers all of North America and is therefore the one that can travel with me. I very highly recommend this guide.
customer_reviews.author: Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: A great book for the price
customer_reviews.text: A great book for the price. I always being this book with me in the field. Easy to use and covers a lot of species!
customer_reviews.author: Sami Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Best butterfly and skipper guidebook.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best guidebook for butterfly and skipper identification. I keep it near my flower borders all the time.Take it along when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Kent V. Frank

customer_reviews.title: This is going to be a huge help to this ...
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be a huge help to this novice in ID'ing butterflies in my yard and surrounding areas!
customer_reviews.author: Cupid's Cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Excelllent Resource
customer_reviews.text: Know the difference between a butterfly and a moth? I do now. My wife treasures this book. I bought it for her because I love her. Well written and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guide with a quality built book
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Guide with a quality built book. I use it weekly and it still looks and uses like new. I have owned it since 2009. RL
customer_reviews.author: Richard Leamon

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies of NA great for butterfly. Counts
customer_reviews.text: The book met my expectations for doing butterfly counts and is ideal for me since I spend time in both eastern and western North America. It shows the field markings and maps help determine if the species should be present or not.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbe Fitzgibbon

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide on Butterflies of North America
customer_reviews.text: This is a well put together field guide and will come in handy when trying to identify the many butterflies that come not only to our backyard but also in the various parks we walk in.
customer_reviews.author: WHB

customer_reviews.title: Good field guide
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any butterfly enthusiast. This is my second copy as the first was left behind in my summer house. It is easy to use, easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: John R Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for curious kids!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter went through a butterfly phase and I wanted to encourage her curiosity with this book. It is perfect and she was able to use it easily! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: pandactr

customer_reviews.title: excellent guide!
customer_reviews.text: Best butterfly guide ever! Beautiful color photos help perfectly with identification.
customer_reviews.author: wiseshanks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the novice who needs good visual (pictures) for identification.
customer_reviews.text: A great book, especially for novices who need the good visual for identification.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Wells

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It makes me want to live somewhere there are more butterflies!
customer_reviews.author: Debby McKelvey

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to our wildlife library
customer_reviews.text: Description said it was not new and in good condition....NOT TRUE! it was in GREAT condition and we love using it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great photos
customer_reviews.text: Great photos of the butterflies, Good book for anyone wanting to identify butterflies. Helpful infomation about hundreds of North American species.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Mills

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love that the illustrations contain both open and side views. Great little ID book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies of North America
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed at the ease of using this book to identify butterflies. I plan to use the check list at the back of the book to see how many species I actually do identify.
customer_reviews.author: Lorry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this guide. It is such a great resource.
customer_reviews.author: Nico0157

customer_reviews.title: Not good for field ID
customer_reviews.text: I got this book to help narrow down a tattoo idea, not really for use when I'm out and about. That being said, I wouldn't use it for field identification. It's not sorted in a way that someone with little butterfly knowledge would find useful. It's not done by region, color, or time of the year. So unless you know a what family of butterfly something is it's only going to help you so much. It did what I needed it to do, thus the 4 stars. If I was using it for hikes I would probably rate it a 2-3
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Best and easiest butterfly guide I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This guide was that best tool I had out in the field last summer while counting Karner Blue Butterflies and being able to distinguish them from the other little blues out there. It is easy to find identifying characteristics and size -- a great guide for the field.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Litchfield

customer_reviews.title: Best guide I've ever
customer_reviews.text: Used this so often the past 2 summers! Best guide I've ever found
customer_reviews.author: Jetana

customer_reviews.title: Kaufman book are the best!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Kaufman guides are fabulous for identifcation and general information. I have others by Kaufman as well and highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin A. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for field work.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. High detail photos, good, and easy script for field work.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina C MacGaffin

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly Book
customer_reviews.text: The design is OMG!! I love the brightness/color! The price and availability of the product is amazing!! A must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Debi R. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great field guide. I've used it successfully in Arizona, and Sonora and Baja California, Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Avila

customer_reviews.title: Highly detailed
customer_reviews.text: This book provides highly detailed photos of all of North America's butterflies, as well as provides tips on what to look for such as the type of flight, what plants it eats, seasons and locations. It could probably be considered a more advanced book, but if you spend the time to read the various introductions, it is a great guide!
customer_reviews.author: westjonwest

customer_reviews.title: Great Field guide
customer_reviews.text: My son collects butterflies as a hobby. I couldn't tell one from another until I bought this guide which he recommended. Now even I can tell what's in the net.
customer_reviews.author: Tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: It is waiting for gift wrap to go under the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is waiting for gift wrap to go under the tree. Joe job all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. J. Peek

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This book is for people who do not know a thing about butterflies but want to learn. Very informative with great artwork.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Lansing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a very useful book if you're into butterflies. lots of good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ron L

customer_reviews.title: A very easy and thorough field guide
customer_reviews.text: The illustrations and maps are superb. A very easy and thorough field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Milam

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies of North America (Kaufman Focus Guides)
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect book for identifying butterflies and moths. Whether you are a novice or more knowledgeable there is a wealth of information. The organization of the book is very user friendly showing geographic habitat, outstanding color plates and silhouette of adult butterflies. Excellent descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: kdm

product_meta.title: Kaufman Field Guide to Butterflies of North America (Kaufman Focus Guides)
